item.title: Report X-2024071762
item.description:
Report X-2024071762

Identified by scraper @ 2024-08-01T15:14:26+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-07-11
  • City: ROSEVILLE
  • State: CA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Federal Express Corporation
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: Package was discovered leaking and QA was notified. Spill was clean and package was collect and placed in a plastic lined tote and placed in the QA damage area. Package was discovered to be regulated and there was no labels on the package declaring it so. The box was also inadequate for packing group III.

  • Serious Incident Ind: No

item.title: Report X-2024071624
item.description:
Report X-2024071624

Identified by scraper @ 2024-07-31T21:13:28+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-07-02
  • City: BLOOMINGTON
  • State: CA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Federal Express Corporation
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: Upon inspection it was found that the package was wet from the top after being tipped over. It was discovered that the package contained 2 hazardous bottles (rapicidepa part a) and 2 nonhazardous bottles (rapicidepa part b). It was found that one of the part b bottles had a loose cap resulting in the leakage.

item.title: Report E-2024070640
item.description:
Report E-2024070640

Identified by scraper @ 2024-07-29T09:15:12+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-06-28
  • City: SANTA FE SPRINGS
  • State: CA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: XPO LOGISTICS FREIGHT, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 7500
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: It was reported that 2-gallons of UN2289 Baxxodur EC 201 released from a 2000-pound plastic tote due to improper loading. Clean Harbors was dispatched to the site. Upon the contractors arrival, personnel observed that the released material impacted a 6ft-by-6ft area of the dock floor and estimated that two (2) gallons of material were released from one (1) 275-gallon tote. Clean Harbors personnel deployed absorbents and then swept up the released material. The damaged tote and recovered material were placed into four (4) 55-gallon poly drums and was staged onsite at the terminal prior to the contractor demobilization.

Package was placed in a tote for QA inspection. upon analysis, contents are 2 cans of Lube-lok 5396 diluted with 1 can being dented, causing its lid to open and cause its liquid content to spill. Better inner packing would prevent dents that would cause lids to pop open.

item.title: Report E-2024070592
item.description:
Report E-2024070592

Identified by scraper @ 2024-07-26T18:15:58+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-07-15
  • City: CERES
  • State: CA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: R & L CARRIERS, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 5000
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: On July 15, 2024, eight (8) 5-gallon pails of NA1993 were crushed in transit and released approximately forty (40) gallons of product to the trailer interior. R+L Carriers retained Cura Emergency Services, LC who dispatched a crew from Ancon Services (ACS) to remediate the impacted site. ACS personnel utilized absorbents and hand tools to remediate the impacted trailer. All impacted materials were containerized in two (2) 55-gallon drums for disposal.

  • Incident Date: 2024-07-05
  • City: LOS ANGELES

  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0

  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: Package came out of trailer 825967 in a wet leaking state, which was placed in a tote and QA inspection was done. Finding was 4 bottles of Concentrated lime and rust remover bottles with 1 bottle have a loose cap from abrasion on movement, which lead its liquid content to spill out of the bottle. Better packing to prevent caps from abrasion would have help prevent the loose cap and spill.

item.title: Report I-2024070086
item.description:

  • Incident Date: 2024-06-12
  • City: Vernon
  • State: CA
  • Report Type: Undeclared Shipment with no Release

  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
